results.title: The New Italian
results.creator_credit: Intertel, Westinghouse Broadcasting, National Educational Television, Michael Alexander and Joseph Krumgold
results.brief_description: Using the small village of Gerrandina in the south as an example, this is a survey of the Italian government’s attempt to deal with Italy’s surplus population. Formerly this problem had been solved by immigration, but now land reform and more industrialisation are bringing more work and better living conditions to the southern Italian peasant

results.title: The New Ipswich
results.creator_credit: Australian news and Information Bureau and Eric Thompson
results.brief_description: The story of the way of life of the people in Ipswich, Queensland. Scenes include: the Alan Cunnigham memorial (explorer) railway workshop, woollen mill, timber mill and coal mines, schools and leisure activities. Music by Robert Hughes.

results.title: The New healers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Healers quacks or mystics”.
Over a quarter of a million Australians now use the services of alternative healers, a sign, perhaps, of a new understanding of the holistic nature of health care where the patient can do much to achieve good health. In this episode, presenter Nevill Drury interviews a chiropractor; naturopath, Dorothy Hall, who explains iridology and how it can be used to diagnose illness; Melbourne surgeon, Avri Sali, who explains how dietary change can prevent gallstones and bowel disease; and participants at Hopewood Health Centre and Euroa House who use relaxation techniques, healthy diet and rebirthing to improve their lives.

results.title: The New global geography
results.creator_credit: John Selwyn Gilbert, Channel Four, Antelope Films and Network Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Spaceship Earth”.
In conjunction with modern computing power, space technology is helping scientists to create global geography. The aim is to discover how Spaceship Earth’s life-support system really works, and how natural and human forces are changing it. Satellites help us to understand our planet, particularly in monitoring global weather patterns which can shift rapidly.

results.title: The New friend
results.brief_description: Adaptation of the book “The New friend” by Charlotte Zolotow in which two young girls are best friends and constant companions until suddently one of the girls finds someone new to play with. Tis leaves her former friend hurt and confused.

results.title: The New epidemic
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Peter Thompson and Susan Cornwell
results.brief_description: The Adverse Drug Reaction Advisory Committee monitors doctors, dentists and chemists for adverse drug effects. The monitoring program emphasises the genuine need for good information on the use and effects of drugs. The film presents seven dramatised case studies based on real-life stories reported to the Committee.

results.title: The New distribution
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Marketing”.
One of a marketing series which specifically deals with the problem of “How do you get your product from the shop floor to the high street?”. The series explores the whole range of marketing activities involved in moving a product or service from the factory to the consumer.

results.title: The New councillor
results.brief_description: Through the experiences of Richards, a newly elected borough councillor, shows the varied activities of a typical councillor - the people’s relationship both with the people who elected him and the permanent officials who carry out the policy laid down by the council.
